topics.body:
I quit watching mlp when there was that equestria girls drama.

I just got fucking tired of all the people going, "you can't be a brony unless you love equestria girls and love and worship every single episode!" shit that was being thrown around so I was like "in that case I'm no longer a brony".  I personally didn't like the movie cause it was way too reminiscent of high school musical in that both movies they sing to solve their problems and the goals of both the movies is to win the prom and that's my personal preference that I don't like high school musical, but if loving and worshipping the movie is a requirement for being a part of the fandom then I guess I'm not a brony and quit watching the show.  If someone liked the movie or disliked the movie that's their personal preference, but I just got tired of all the people going "liking the movie is a fundamental requirement to being a brony".

topics.body:
I never actually called myself a brony before.
Sure, I like the show and the comics (even the movies) but I was never obsessive with it and declared myself a "brony".
The only fandom I ever declared myself to be part of is the Sonic fandom. And that's only because they have awesome OCs and actually good fan comics.
